event.title: include the Ashtabula County Fair, the Strawberry Festival, Jefferson Days

data.event: Annual village events include the Ashtabula County Fair, the Strawberry Festival, Jefferson Days, and the Covered Bridge Festival.

event.title: was officially founded by Gideon Granger—U.S. Postmaster General during Thomas Jefferson's administration—in 1803

data.event: Jefferson was officially founded by Gideon Granger—U.S. Postmaster General during Thomas Jefferson's administration—in 1803.

event.title: was erected by Granger's agent in 1804

data.event: A cabin was erected by Granger's agent in 1804, but the settlement's first permanent residents arrived only in 1805: the Samuel Wilson family.
A cabin was erected by Granger's agent in 1804, but the settlement's first permanent residents arrived only in 1805: the Samuel Wilson family.

event.title: moved to Ohio in late autumn

data.event: Wilson, misled by land agents, moved to Ohio in late autumn expecting to find a thriving city on Granger's land.
Wilson himself died after two weeks of herculean effort to prepare for the winter, but his family stayed on as the first citizens of Jefferson.
Wilson himself died after two weeks of herculean effort to prepare for the winter, but his family stayed on as the first citizens of Jefferson.
